messageBody:
anijoshi01201 wrote:

> I trying to build a java application that uses log4j for logging. My
> test targets use log4j. When I try to test the class with JUnit the
> test throws exception. The test works fine if I remove all logging
> statements from the test class. Also, the target class work fine
> (with logger) when it is run outside of junit.
>
> My stak trace look something like this....
>
> java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError
> at testXXX.common.AppDBPoolSingletonTest.testConnection
> (AppDBPoolSingletonTest.java:40)
<snip />
> Any clues???

Yes. Read the JUnit FAQ, the section on class loading problems might be
useful. As a quick experiment, try running the tests in the text-based
test runner, rather than the Swing-based one. If that's not the problem,
then I don't know.

Good luck.
